instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00426: What is 820-00426? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..
definitions.820-00163: What is 820-00163? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LCD_BKLT_EN: What is LCD_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “LCD_BKLT” which stands for “LCD screen backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal display boots fine on external, does not detect internal
threads.message:
No liquid that can be seen. Case is in good condition and dosen't suggest a drop or physical incident.

No backlight and no image on internal LCD.
External monitor connected, machine boots with external as main screen. (showing Apple logo etc externally so not detecting internal)
Tried new internal DP cable to LCD, no change.
Tried known good 2015 LCD assembly no change.

<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> a flat 0v diode mode (LCD attached) 1.19v drop to ground.
<SIGNAL>PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD</SIGNAL> 5v

Working off a boardview for <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> the area round the LVDS/eDP is different.

Using the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board view all the <SIGNAL>LED_RETURN</SIGNAL> lines (pins 3 through 8) are (diode mode) 0.49 - 0.52v drop to ground.
Checked other pins and compared to board view no unexpected shorts.
regretfully don't have any donors for these at this time.

Any help or thoughts appreciated!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal display boots fine on external, does not detect internal
threads.message:
First of all, forget "v" sign when you post diode mode.
That generates confusion.

"<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> a flat 0v diode mode"
Becauise in this case you have a short...
Unless you've interpreted "OL" shown in diode mode as 0V; wrong assumption.

Always post diode mode readings in 3 digit after dot point.
For example 543, 0.543, or .543 and we know what that mean; if diode mode is mentioned.

Clarify now what you get in diode mode (red probe to ground) at <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> w/ and w/o LCD connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal display boots fine on external, does not detect internal
threads.message:
My apologies that sentence was not clear.

<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> is 0v when machine running with LCD attached.

diode mode (LCD attached) 1.195
diode mode (LCD NOT attached) same 1.195

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal display boots fine on external, does not detect internal
threads.message:
Confirm if eDP cvonnector (LCD) is same as <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MLB.
If yes, check voltages at pins 9 and 28-30.
Be sure R/L8300 are OK.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal display boots fine on external, does not detect internal
threads.message:
Seems like this has a much similar eDP/LVDS area to the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> which i do have boardview / donor for.

With LCD attached and machine powered i do get
(pin 5) <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_EDP_SW</SIGNAL> = 3.3v
(pin 8 ) <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_PWM_R</SIGNAL> = 2.4v
(pin 9) <SIGNAL>LCD_HPD_CONN</SIGNAL> = 3.3v
(pins 28-30) <SIGNAL>PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD</SIGNAL> = 5v.

comparing all pins to <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (donor) not seeing anything with more than 5-10% difference in diode mode.

<RESISTOR>R8300</RESISTOR> reads as 0ohm as per schematic.
L8300 seems to be doing its job as 5v is present on pin 2

Real head scratcher.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal display boots fine on external, does not detect internal
threads.message: With all those voltage lines there I would think you should have image....tried known good 2015 15" screen? Can't be 2013/14 has to be 15.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal display boots fine on external, does not detect internal
threads.message: Yes, 2015 15" known good screen testing with. Totally don't get it at all.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal display boots fine on external, does not detect internal
threads.message:
LCD seems to be correctly detected.
Did you test complete LCD assembly?
May be bad video cable, or even LCD connector.
Are you sure no image at all?
Check with a flashlight (from the back) for the quiestion mark folder (no SSD connected).

"(pin 8 ) <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_PWM_R</SIGNAL> = 2.4v"
Any change pressing backlight control keys?
Also check pins 6 & 7 at same time; better an o-scope there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal display boots fine on external, does not detect internal
threads.message:
Yes whole new assembly. Also tried new LVDS/edp cable on the old screen.

Tried with phone torch and mircoscope LED ring. Cannot see anything.

PWM does not change with brightness keys.

If both internal and external displays attached i get the Apple logo / ALT key screens on the external (as if the internal was disconnected).

Not sure if this goes anywhere but...
<SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> is 0v
I would still expect an image however even if backlight is 0v.

Will have to have a look into pins 6 & 7 and  get back,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal display boots fine on external, does not detect internal
threads.message:
May be GMUX issue.
Reflow and change it, if still no result.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal display boots fine on external, does not detect internal
threads.message: Made it back to the top of the pile,  went through everything again. Noticed that FL8303 was chipped replaced it and it now works. Thanks for your help.
